intro: Lapeirousia barklyi, commonly known as the Orange River daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllis family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers with red markings. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, fibrous root system. Lapeirousia barklyi is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid environments.
